Package frc.robot.lib

Class SwerveModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • frc.robot.lib.SwerveModule
  • public class SwerveModule
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the turning and driving controllers of a swerve module.

    The turning contoller is a combination of feedback and feedforward control. The feedback control is achieved using a profiled PID controller (trapezoidal profile and constraints) using the absolute encoder to seed the reletive encoder for feedback. The feedforward control is achieved by using a simple permanent-magnet DC motor model which zeros the acceleration coefficient (due to the trapezoid profile implementation).

    The driving controller is also a combination of feedback and feedforward control. The feedback control is achieved using a velocity controller and the REV NEO onboard relative encoder. The feedforward control is achieved by using a simple permanent-magnet DC motor model which zeros the acceleration coefficient (due to the trapezoid profile implementation).

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwerveModule

        public SwerveModule​(java.lang.String label,
                    int turnMotorId,
                    int driveMotorId,
                    int pwmChannel,
                    int quadChannelA,
                    int quadChannelB,
                    double maxTurnVelRps,
                    double maxTurnAccRpss,
                    double turnFeedforwardKs,
                    double turnFeedforwardKv,
                    double turnFeedforwardKa,
                    double driveFeedforwardKs,
                    double driveFeedforwardKv,
                    double driveFeedforwardKa)
        Constructor for a SparkMax swerve drive module using the RoboRIO to control both the steering and driving.
        Parameters:
        label - the module identifier
        turnMotorId - the turning motor controller CAN ID
        driveMotorId - the driving motor controller CAN ID
        pwmChannel - the RoboRIO DIO channel number of the encoder PWM signal
        quadChannelA - the RoboRIO DIO channel number of the encoder quadrature A signal
        quadChannelB - the RoboRIO DIO channel number of the encoder quadrature B signal
        maxTurnVelRps - the turning motor maximum angular velocity in radians-per-second
        maxTurnAccRpss - the turning motor maximum angular acceleration in radians-per-second
        turnFeedforwardKs - the turning motor FF model static coefficient
        turnFeedforwardKv - the turning motor FF model velocity coefficient
        turnFeedforwardKa - the turning motor FF model acceleration coefficient
        driveFeedforwardKs - the driving motor FF model static coefficient
        driveFeedforwardKv - the driving motor FF model velocity coefficient
        driveFeedforwardKa - the driving motor FF model acceleration coefficient

    • Method Detail

      • logTelemetry

        public void logTelemetry()
        Log the telemetry data to disk using the WPILib logger.

      • setDesiredState

        public void setDesiredState​(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState state)
        Set the desired state of the swerve module.

        The input swerve state is a speed in meters-per-second and an angle represented as a Rotation2D object. The desired angle is first optimized to keep the wheel from turning more than 90 degrees. This is done by allowing the wheel to reverse the current drive direction. Next, the turning and driving output voltages are calculated using a combination of feedback and feedforward controllers. Finally, the turning and driving output voltages are sent out to the motors.

        Parameters:
        state - the desired state of the swerve module

      • setHomeOffset

        public void setHomeOffset​(double homeRad)
        Set offset of the modules azimuth angle by using the input absolute "home" angle and the current angle read from the duty cycle endcoder.
        Parameters:
        homeRad - the "home" angle of the duty cycle endoder in radians

      • setIdle

        public void setIdle()

      • setIdleMode

        public void setIdleMode​(boolean isBrakeDesired)
        Set the idle mode of the module motors.
        Parameters:
        isBrakeDesired - true sets brake mode, false sets coast mode
